bibl.title: Letter from Francis L. Berkeley, Jr., to Bertha Lyons, April 3, 1948

div1.p: Berkeley lists the photostats of Reed items he is sending to Lyons for use in the Hall of Fame program.

div1.head: Letter from Francis L. Berkeley, Jr., to Bertha Lyons, April 3, 1948
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
3 April 1948
DIVISION OF RARE BOOKS
AND
MANUSCRIPTS
My dear Miss Lyons:
div1.p:
At the request of Dr. Philip S. Hench, of the Mayo
Clinic, we send you the enclosed photostats of items owned by
Dr. Hench as follows:
1. Photostat, letter of Walter Reed to Mrs. Reed,
9 December 1900.
2. The same for letter of 25-26 December 1900.
3. The same for New Year's Eve letter of 31
December,-1 January 1901.
4. Obverse and reverse of Reed's Congressional
Medal.
5. The same for Walter Reed Medal of the American
Society of Tropical Medicine.
6. Photograph of Lazear's microscope.
7. Photograph of the paper cutter made from wood
from Walter Reed's birthplace, the paper cutter
presented to Mrs. Reed.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Francis L. Berkeley, Jr.
Curator of Manuscripts Miss Bertha L. Lyons
Assistant to the Director
Hall of Fame, New York University
1 Madison Avenue
New York 10, New York
